Class Animal

java.lang.Object
org.wildloop.Animal
Direct Known Subclasses:
Predator, Prey
public abstract class Animal extends Object
Abstract base class representing an animal in the simulation. Defines basic behaviors and attributes common to all animals, such as movement, reproduction, eating and energy management.
See Also:
  • Prey
  • Predator

  • Constructor Details

    • Animal

      public Animal(Position position, int energy, int maxAge)
      Creates a new animal with given initial parameters.
      Parameters:
      position - initial position
      energy - initial energy level
      maxAge - maximum age the animal can reach

  • Method Details

    • getPosition

      public Position getPosition()
      Returns:
      current position of the animal

    • getEnergy

      public int getEnergy()
      Returns:
      current energy level of the animal

    • getAge

      public int getAge()
      Returns:
      current age of the animal

    • getMaxAge

      public int getMaxAge()
      Returns:
      maximum age that the animal can reach

    • setPosition

      public void setPosition(Position position)
      Parameters:
      position - new position of the animal

    • setEnergy

      public void setEnergy(int energy)
      Parameters:
      energy - new energy level

    • incrementAge

      public void incrementAge()
      Increases animal age by 1

    • setWorld

      public void setWorld(World world)
      Parameters:
      world - world in which the animal will be placed

    • move

      void move()
      Moves the animal in the direction determined by getNextMoveDirection(). Movement is only performed if the new position is valid and empty. Each move costs energy specified by MOVE_ENERGY_COST.

    • getNextMoveDirection

      protected abstract Direction getNextMoveDirection()
      Determines the direction of the next animal movement. Implementation depends on the specific animal type.
      Returns:
      movement direction or null if the animal cannot move

    • reproduce

      void reproduce()
      Tries to reproduce the animal if it has enough energy. Offspring is created on an empty adjacent cell.

    • createOffspring

      protected abstract Animal createOffspring(Position position)
      Creates a new animal of the same type. Implementation depends on the specific animal type.
      Parameters:
      position - position for the new animal
      Returns:
      new animal

    • findEmptyAdjacentCell

      private Position findEmptyAdjacentCell()
      Finds an empty cell adjacent to the current animal position.
      Returns:
      position of empty adjacent cell or null if none found

    • eat

      protected abstract void eat()
      Defines the feeding behavior of the animal. Implementation depends on the specific animal type.

    • die

      public void die()
      Removes the animal from the world (animal dies).

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates the animal's state in each simulation turn. Performs the following actions:
      1. Increases age
      2. Makes a move
      3. Tries to find food
      4. Tries to reproduce if has enough energy
      5. Dies if runs out of energy or exceeds maximum age
